Tim Berresheim’s Bilderreise – an Augmented-Reality cycling route through the Heinsberger Land region

Welcome to the Heinsberger Land region, with its soft-rolling landscapes and endless horizon. Here, in the westernmost corner of Germany, nature meets culture – thanks to over 550 km of cycle paths that are connected to form an excellently-developed network of pure biking bliss.

Easy to navigate and jam-packed with sights, Tim Berresheim’s Bilderreise weaves a total of three options into this web of cycling routes: the full distance on a scenic circular itinerary worth roughly 90 km or, splitting the route into smaller portions, a western loop (approx. 51 km) and an eastern loop (approx. 45 km). The trails beautifully intertwine historic surroundings and striking contemporary art made with cutting-edge technology – in a way never seen before.

All along the route, “TB – Bilderreise AR” adds a minimum of 17 augmented-reality experiences to a number of locations hand-picked by Tim Berresheim: tailor-made computer-animated works by the digital artist that can be viewed, explored and played with by the user.

For added convenience while you’re pedalling away on your bike, the app is equipped with a route map to help with orientation – together with a free pocket guide and signs that have been placed on the official signposts along the way. The route and additional navigation options can also be found at outdooractive.de.

Parking is available at the official starting point, the tourist information office Naturpark-Tor (Pontorsonallee 16, 41849 Wassenberg). If you’re visiting during the week and would like to start your explorations with some lofty views from Wassenberg’s medieval tower, the Bergfried, feel free to ask for the keys at the tourist office.

If you are planning to arrive by public transport, the best option is to catch a train or bus to Heinsberg (Rheinland) station and then start your tour e.g. from the tourist info point at the BEGAS HAUS museum (Hochstraße 21, 52525 Heinsberg).

To find out more about the perks of using this app, check out the tutorial featuring John Lemon. In the video, the citrusy tour guide also explains how to access some exciting augmented-reality sneak previews – from the comfort of your home.
More recommendations and suggestions on how to make your time in the region truly memorable are available at heinsberger-land.de as well as on Facebook and Instagram.
